label: 地主
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Also called Tato (Rice Field Master ). A local landholder wealthier than the ordinary farmers or villeins (yoriudo ), but not as wealthy as the Lords of Manors (Ryōshu ). He generally commended his lands to a Load of Manors and served as one of his Manorial Officials (Shōshi ). [田堵、寄人、領主、荘司]
